DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate use subcutaneous impedance measure implanted Medtronic Reveal LINQ™ insertable cardiac monitor ( ICM ) respiratory rate monitor .
DOC.criteria: Suspected arrhythmia Diastolic Heart Failure and/or Renal Failure . Chronic Kidney Disease ( CKD ) Stage 5 ( GFR = < 15 mL/min ) . Diastolic Heart Failure class II class III ( class IV consider end stage nonreversible ) . Willing sign inform consent form . Greater 18 year age . Enrolled another study could confound result study , without document preapproval Medtronic study manager . Significant respiratory disease COPD pulmonary hypertension . Frequent arrhythmia , include PVC 's . Known systolic heart failure . Recent infection . Allergenic rejection reaction material use incision/insertion tool , Reveal LINQ™ ICM exterior incision closure method . Active implant cardiac medical device ( e.g . IPG , ICD , CRT , etc ) . Not suitable Reveal LINQ™ implantation ( e.g. , severe cachexia , dermatologic condition skin ) concomitant condition opinion investigator would allow safe participation study . Body condition would complicate accurate measurement respiratory effort external device deploy around chest . Not able take posture necessary study protocol able walk continuously period 6 minute . Any concomitant condition opinion investigator would allow safe participation study .
